samples.question: [Transcript chunk 4]
samples.transcript: Talks she is not like other teachers as she she did not only want us to concern about our studies but also wanted us to boost our new skills build good habits and to find our passion and as a obedient teenager I used to follow her every advice so what I did like I was interested in music and I totally immerged myself into it and gradually evolved in it I did not only thrive in the area of music but she also helped me to build good habits like reading good books watching good content working out daily and studying regularly so now she does not teach us but we both are still in contact and meet occasionally whenever I meet her I feel so energized and motivated which leads me to do better in my music and other things MH but so I feel I am very Amazed by my progress music is my hobby which I enjoy I will always be grateful for my for Mrs Cano Pria ma'am for being this motivational speaker in my life for inspiring me to for inspiring me to pursue my passion okay that is great thank you so much good okay so now there is a time to ask some followup questions which will be based on the Q card so prachi may I know who motivate children the most I think parents and teachers are the great source of motivation for students when student when children see their parents working really hard for them for making money they think to pay them off in future and teachers teachers guide them they provide knowledge to them okay so why you think that these people motivate them most I think.

samples.question: How has technology made our life easier?

samples.question: Is it more difficult for old people to accept new technologies?
samples.transcript: Yes. old people often face more challenges accepting and adapting to new technologies instead of younger people because they are not familiar with the digital devices. Okay.
